intro: [WRONG START] Goniothalamus prainianianus var. angustipetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petalled goniothalamus, is a member of the Annonaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a fleshy, woody berry that contains several seeds.
